comments.body: doesn't the CupertinoPicker have a tap recognizer?
It doesn't. It's a pretty wonky interaction on iOS so it only scrolls for now.

comments.body: Do you need these Expanded here? Perhaps you can show me visually tomorrow. You should be able to get the effect you want with MainAxisAlignment

Removing the wrapping Expanded will invoke the error: BoxConstraints forces an infinite width.
So for simplification I'm wrapping an Expanded around each CupertinoPicker.
We should fix this. I'll take a look

I see the issue. We can fix this in a future PR since this PR is really close already. 

Design-wise: we may want a multi-column picker in the end but with some of the constructor params extracted out. For instance, it wouldn't make sense (at least as a Cupertino widget) to have side by side pickers that has different magnifications, item extents or height in general etc. It would also be sensible to provide a single onChange callback that snapshots all the columns and a child delegate that deals with multiple columns. 

That widget could use ListWheelScrollView directly and _buildGradientScreen and _buildMagnifierScreen once instead of once per column currently.
Agree, I will come back to this later.

comments.body: It's confusing that _buildColorPicker() and _buildCountdownTimerPicker sound similar but build entirely different things. Make sure the things that builds the thing that opens a picker and the things that builds the picker are named consistently differently.
